channel.title: BBC News - Latin America & Caribbean
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Mexico: Powerful earthquake hits Acapulco
item.description: The magnitude-seven quake struck near Acapulco, and was felt around 370 km away in Mexico City.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro: Only God will remove me from power
item.description: With his approval rating at a low, Brazil's leader strikes a defiant note on independence day.

item.title: Premier League: Clubs hopeful players will be cleared to play this weekend
item.description: Premier League clubs remain hopeful their players will be released for matches this weekend, after four national associations trigger a Fifa rule to prevent them appearing.

item.title: Bitcoin crashes on first day as El Salvador's legal tender
item.description: Technological glitches plagued the first day of El Salvador accepting Bitcoin as legal tender.

item.title: Flooding hits Mexico hospital, killing 17 patients
item.description: A river bursts its banks in the town of Tula, cutting power and oxygen at the facility, officials say.

item.title: Climate change: Vulnerable nations call for 'emergency pact'
item.description: The countries at greatest risk say all nations must take bigger steps to avoid climate catastrophe.

item.title: Mexico decriminalises abortion in landmark ruling
item.description: The Supreme Court rules that prosecuting women for terminating pregnancies is unconstitutional.

item.title: Brazil v Argentina: Disciplinary action started against both nations after abandoned qualifier
item.description: Fifa says disciplinary proceedings have been launched against Brazil and Argentina after the events that saw their World Cup qualifier abandoned.

item.title: Fear and excitement in El Salvador as Bitcoin becomes legal tender
item.description: Millions of Salvadorians are expected to download a digital wallet app with $30 of free Bitcoin.

item.title: Bolsonaro: New bill will limit tech giants' power to remove content
item.description: Brazil's president signs a decree requiring firms to provide "just cause" before removing posts.

item.title: Mexico City to swap Columbus statue for one of indigenous woman
item.description: Mexico City's mayor said a statue of an Olmeca woman would replace that of the Italian explorer.

item.title: El Salvador court rules presidents can serve two consecutive terms
item.description: The Supreme Court rules that presidents can serve two consecutive terms, a move attacked by critics.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
item.description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.

item.title: Image of bird at US-Mexico border wall wins contest
item.description: The winning image by Mexican photographer Alejandro Prieto shows a roadrunner at the border wall.

item.title: 'We felt free': Cubans remain defiant in face of protest crackdown
item.description: A month after rare anti-government protests in Cuba, many of those who took part remain defiant.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: The forgotten villages cut off from help
item.description: The tremor razed their homes, but these survivors could still die for a lack of basic supplies.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Search for survivors amid devastation
item.description: Almost 2,000 people are known to have died in Saturday's powerful earthquake.

item.title: Mexico earthquake: Lights seen in sky during tremor near Acapulco
item.description: The magnitude-seven quake struck the country's Pacific coast, near the resort of Acapulco.

item.title: Mexico: Flash flooding sweeps away cars after heavy rain
item.description: Heavy rain in central Mexico sparked flash floods in Ecatepec and Nexahualcóyotl.

item.title: ICYMI: Catwalk hail storm and cheeky capybaras
item.description: Some of the stories that you may have missed this week.

item.title: Paddle boarder's close encounter with two curious whales
item.description: A drone filmed what the paddle boarder, out on the water on her birthday, calls a "magical moment".

item.title: Daniel Dias: History's greatest para-swimmer
item.description: Daniel Dias has won more than 25 medals for Brazil over the past four Paralympic Games but will be retiring after Tokyo.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Mother mourns daughter killed during christening
item.description: Locals say 22 people died when a church collapsed during a mass christening.
